result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. GIOVANNI M. MEDINA

Defendant GIOVANNI M. MEDINA in court, in custody.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for GIOVANNI M. MEDINA.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim appeared via video from WCJ.  Waived reading of Information.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Ty Gasparek appeared by video for GIOVANNI M. MEDINA. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 930
Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
POSS FIREARM-CONV OF FEL, POSS METH, INTENTIONALLY GIVE FALSE ALARM
CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing. No possession of dangerous weapons. No possession of firearms or facsimile firearms.
